body.p: Your petitioner represents that he is an old man, that there are Five Judgments in the Warren Equity & Criminal Court against him for Keeping a Tippling house -- upon which Casas have issued, that he was unable to attend and defend the same That they are unjust, that he has no means to pay, & unless your Excellency will remit them he will, in his old age, be confined in Jail & still be unable to pay them
Wherefor he prays an excise of your clemency in the remission of the portion of said fines going to the commonwealth & will ever pray &c
The undersigned are neighbors and acquaintances of the petitioner Duke R Hardwick and State that he has no means to pay the fines against him
That he is an old man & we Join him in the prayer that said fines may be remitted.

May 19th 1863
